featured.title: Welcome to Our Church Family
featured.description1: Holy City of God Christian Fellowship is a part of the Body of Christ that is centered on Christ Himself, and His mission of reconciliation. We understand that true reconciliation to God is the process of having an intimate and loving relationship with our Creator. During this process a nurturing relationship is formed, and we find our hope, peace, love, fulfillment, and joy in Him. We believe this is our foundational relationship that hinges the success of all other relationships.
featured.description2: We agree with Peter when he said, "Silver and gold have I none; but such as I have give I thee: in the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth," having Jesus is better than having silver or gold. Maintaining this relationship revolutionizes our entire lives. Holy City is dedicated to the personal success of every member. We are committed to reach beyond carnal limitations and inherit the promise of eternal life; therefore, all of our efforts are focused and directed towards this purpose.

pastor.title: Meet Our Pastor
pastor.name: Bishop Anthony King, Sr.
pastor.bio: Bishop Anthony K. King, Sr. is the founding pastor of Holy City of God Christian Fellowship, Inc., in Detroit, Michigan. Bishop King also serves as First Assistant Presiding Bishop of Maranatha Faith Fellowship International, Inc, in McDonough, Georgia. His ministry has shaped and encouraged the lives of thousands of people in his over 25-year ministry tenure. Therefore, Spiritual Formation is the foundation of his leadership. Bishop King's greatest passion is building people and helping them recognize that God is at work in their lives.
pastor.quote: It is ALL good, no matter how it looks or feels. - Bishop King's life motto

vision.title: Ministry Vision & Mandate
vision.quote: Let us go on to perfection (maturity)
vision.description: Bishop King's leadership inspiration and divine mandate, received in a vision in 1998, has become his mandate and mantra. His greatest joy is to see God's people mature in Him. He truly enjoys recognizing and developing potential in those whom he leads.

sections.title: Ministry Foundation
sections.content: Bishop Anthony K. King, Sr. is the founding pastor of Holy City of God Christian Fellowship, Inc., in Detroit, Michigan. Bishop King also serves as First Assistant Presiding Bishop of Maranatha Faith Fellowship International, Inc, in McDonough, Georgia. His ministry has shaped and encouraged the lives of thousands of people in his over 25-year ministry tenure. Therefore, Spiritual Formation is the foundation of his leadership. Bishop King's greatest passion is building people and helping them recognize that God is at work in their lives.
sections.quote: It is ALL good, no matter how it looks or feels. - Bishop King's life motto

sections.title: Leadership Background
sections.content: Bishop King's leadership background includes leadership on various levels throughout his walk with Christ. His leadership skills excelled as he trained and led troops in the United States Army during the Gulf War Era. During his military tenure, he received multiple leadership awards, commendations, and recognition for Training Excellence, Good Conduct, and Achievement on various levels. He was commissioned a Kentucky Colonel (the highest Humanitarian Award given by the Commonwealth of Kentucky) in 1995 for his leadership in several community projects throughout the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

sections.title: Community Impact
sections.content: As a leader in the community, Bishop King has been instrumental in developing several organizations designed to transform communities and people. He founded Overcoming Obstacles for People's Success (OOPS), an organization that assists members of the community in securing employment, tutoring, interview coaching, IT training, Life Skills, and much more. He was also instrumental in helping to develop the Field of Dreams Community Development Corporation, created to assist various communities in rebuilding Detroit.
sections.highlight: Bishop King has successfully mentored over 300 people in their professional and entrepreneurial careers.

sections.title: Personal Interests
sections.content: Bishop King enjoys reading, traveling, spending time with family and friends, walks on the beach, nature, live performances, a variety of music, and art. He is a father, grandfather, brother, cousin, nephew, and friend to countless people as well as an inspirer to all with whom he comes in contact. His warm personality and genuine care for others makes him approachable and beloved by the community.

hero.title: Statement of Faith
hero.subtitle: What we believe
hero.content: Our statement of faith outlines the core beliefs that guide our church and unite us as a community of believers.

faithSections.title: The Bible
faithSections.content: We believe the Bible is the inspired, infallible Word of God and our ultimate authority for faith and practice.
faithSections.verse: All Scripture is God-breathed and is useful for teaching

faithSections.title: God
faithSections.content: We believe in one God, eternally existing in three persons: Father, Son, and Holy Spirit.
faithSections.verse: Hear, O Israel: The Lord our God, the Lord is one

faithSections.title: Jesus Christ
faithSections.content: We believe Jesus Christ is the Son of God, fully divine and fully human, who died for our sins and rose again.
faithSections.verse: For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son

faithSections.title: Salvation
faithSections.content: We believe salvation is by grace through faith in Jesus Christ alone, not by works.
faithSections.verse: For it is by grace you have been saved, through faith

faithSections.title: The Church
faithSections.content: We believe the church is the body of Christ, called to worship, fellowship, discipleship, ministry, and evangelism.
faithSections.verse: And I tell you that you are Peter, and on this rock I will build my church

chicagoStatement.title: Chicago Statement on Biblical Inerrancy
chicagoStatement.content: We affirm the Chicago Statement on Biblical Inerrancy as our doctrinal foundation.
